title: Please help with identifying this font.
content:
Hello everybody. Excellent looking forum!

I would like help identifying the font attached.

Does anyone know what that is or can you suggest me any \*preferably\* free fonts that match this font style (not necessarily exactly the same). I am looking for the handwritten script style font and specifically the joined up style of the J and all subsequent letters in the attached picture.

Many thanks to any of you who can help contribute.

David

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071129212445im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/jones_logo_3579.png)

 [‹ pet boutique](http://web.archive.org/web/20071129212445/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39503 "Go to previous forum topic") [help with newspaper faces ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071129212445/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39494 "Go to next forum topic")
author: drj201

comments.content: I’m sure it was handdrawn. You can search dafont.com for script fonts.
Thanks pattyfab. Have you seen anything similar?
